New Records: The Cavaliers extended their franchise-best start to 11-0, becoming just the 12th team in NBA history to start a season 11-0.
Key Match Events: Evan Mobley scored 23 points, grabbed 16 rebounds, and made 4 steals.
Darius Garland contributed 20 points and 6 assists.
The Cavaliers rallied from a 13-point deficit in the 4th quarter to win the game.
Garland sparked the run with a driving layup and scored eight of the Cavs’ final 16 points.
Garland made a pair of go-ahead free throws followed by an assist to Mobley, who made a crucial block before the buzzer.
Donovan Mitchell added 22 points and 4 three-pointers.
Dennis Schröder and Cam Thomas each scored 22 points for Brooklyn.
Post-Match Reflections: Garland: 'We fought. We fought for 48 minutes … That was a big win.'
The Cavaliers are just the 12th team in NBA history to start a season 11-0. Of those 11 previous teams, six made the NBA Finals, and three won it all.
